# Git & GitHub — Minimal Examples

This chapter shows the minimal sequence of commands to create a local repo, commit files, and push to GitHub. These are shell commands; run them in a terminal.

## Quick shell demo

```{bash}
# Create a new project folder and initialize git
mkdir -p ~/tools-in-action-demo
cd ~/tools-in-action-demo

# Initialize a git repository
git init
echo "# Tools in Action Demo" > README.md
git add README.md
git commit -m "chore: initial commit"

# Create a branch and show branch list
git branch -M main

# (Assuming you've created a GitHub repo and replaced the URL below)
# git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/tools-in-action-demo.git
# git push -u origin main
